did.abstract: This collection contains the papers of Sol Gittleman, Tufts University faculty member (1964-2015), Provost and Senior Vice President (1985-2002), and University Professor (2002-2015).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized in three series by format: Student work, course materials, correspondence, photographs; Digital files; and Awards.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Sol Gittleman was born in 1934 in Hoboken, New Jersey. After earning degrees from Drew University (BA, 1955), Columbia University (MA, 1956), and the University of Michigan (PhD, 1961), Gittleman began teaching in the German Department at Tufts University in 1964. In 1966, Gittleman received tenure and was named Chairman of the Departments of German and Russian, and maintained that post until 1981.

Gittleman then served as Provost and Academic Vice President from 1981 through 1985, and Provost and Senior Vice President from 1985 through 2002, teaching continuously during this time. As Provost, Gittleman increased the focus on faculty scholarship and research, and drafted a policy prohibiting sexual relationships between faculty and students.

From 2002 through his retirement in 2015, Gittleman was the Alice and Nathan Gantcher University Professor of Judaic Studies and professor of German, teaching classes ranging from Yiddish literature to German Expressionism to the history of baseball. Gittleman remains involved with University Advancement and the Office of Alumni Relations at Tufts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection documents Sol Gittleman's 51 year career at Tufts University as faculty member, Provost and Senior Vice President, and University Professor. Gittleman's papers include teaching materials, correspondence, reference materials, publications and speeches, photographs, memorabilia, and digital media.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processing performed by Leah Edelman, March 2017. Materials were placed in archival boxes, and loose materials were placed in folders where needed. Original order was maintained at folder level where discernible. Digital files stabilized and processed by Leah Edelman and Margaret Peachy, March 2017. A box-level inventory and series-level description were created and a finding aid was created. Material relating to Gittleman's tenure as Provost and Senior Vice President removed and added to UA002: Office of the Provost and Senior Vice President Records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series documents Sol Gittleman's 51 year career at Tufts University as faculty member, Provost and Senior Vice President, and University Professor. Gittleman's papers include teaching materials, correspondence, reference materials, publications and speeches, and photographs. Teaching materials consist of syllabi, tests, reading materials, notes, and student papers and theses. Correspondence includes both professional and personal materials. Reference materials include photocopies, newspaper clippings, and biographical material. Speeches include matriculation and commencement addresses. Photographs document personal as well as university-related events.
